intro: Centaurium minus subsp. austriacum, commonly known as the Austrian lesser catchfly, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It is a low-growing herb with slender stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or reddish in color. The plant produces tiny, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous minute seeds. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Caryophyllaceae family.
